data.title: Most advanced defenses should detect cloaked units
data.body:
And radar should detect cloaked units and cloaked buildings (if there are any one day).

Reading #6414, pillboxes and flame turrets shouldn’t be able to detect them, because phase tanks require and Allied tech Center to be built, so it’s an expensive endgame vehicle.
It would be frustrating to get the phase transport detected and destroyed by a 400 $ pillbox.

data.title: The spyplane itself is useless and sometimes annoying
data.body:
Spyplanes travel the whole map so you don’t know what is spotted by the enemy. You  could add a teamporary green circle (like the radar one) visible to everyone under the location targeted by the spyplane. The team who sent the spyplane sees under the shroud with the green circle, the other players see only the green circle (or parts of it) where they don’t have the shroud.
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4431532/7500ed96-466b-11e4-8489-1b861e9ed2b4.png)

In the other hand spyplanes are targeted by anti-air buildings/units, so if a spyplane and some air units come at a specific location at the same time, the anti-air can ignore them and target the spyplane instead (for a short while). Also, if the spyplane travels over your mammoth tanks they’ll move in order to shoot the spyplane.

Remove the spyplane or ensure it’s a target for nobody ?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4906902-the-spyplane-itself-is-useless-and-sometimes-annoying?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Championships/Tournaments advertised in "Battlefield News"
data.body: I missed several tournaments because they were advertised on Sleipnir’s Stuff and not in OpenRA, so is it possible to advertise tournaments in the Battlefield News ? More players will be aware of it.

data.title: Destructible "crate planes"
data.body:
In this case, the neutral plane did not release a box at my side. I could have destroyed it to prevent this enemy to obtain a potential bonus.
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4431525/3f55417e-466b-11e4-827e-46e4fdbad456.png)

data.body: Fixes #6579

data.title: [ALL Mods] Option "Disable Walls" and "Disable Superweapons"
data.body: We should implement two options to "disable Superwapons" and to "disable Walls". In RA2 there is such option to Disable SWs but not for Walls... so we should implement them for all Modes in a Match

data.title: Implements original TS elite weapons

Implements elite weapons, matching the original game.

Added weapons to undeployed Tick Tank, the only difference between deployed and undeployed should be the armor type.

data.title: Don’t die when connecting to a full server.
data.body: Fixes an oversight in #6573.

data.title: Allow armaments to be enabled/disabled by upgrades.
data.body:
Split from #6556, this integrates Armaments with the new upgrades system.  This will be useful for elite units and for upgrades such as the mammoth tank railguns in C&C3.

See https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commit/82ebf833cde46c6483caad3191f6bc509b6c3a19 for a testcase.

data.title: Add elite self-healing bonus
data.body:
Split from #6556, this ports SelfHealing to the new upgrade system and adds it as an elite unit bonus.

This doesn't include an upgrade rule for the `RequiresTech` → `RequiresUpgrade` change because it crosses multiple actors, which makes it a difficult thing to do for such a minor feature.

data.title: Implement cell triggers.
data.body: A simple implementation for ground-based actors. Closes #4400.

data.title: Do not validate the color of players which have the LockColor flag set
data.body: Fixes #6572

data.title: Player faction colours in missions are changed by the colour validator
data.body: Introduced in #6512

data.title: Add support for launching directly into games w/ dev cheats enabled
data.body:
Allow launching directly into games w/ dev cheats.

Usage is simple; just pass `Launch.Developer=true` into the command line arguments.

Launching can further be customized with:

  `Launch.Developer.Map`: Select the map to launch
  `Launch.Developer.Cheats`: Specify which cheats to enable
  `Launch.Developer.Bots`: Specify which bots to use. This also limits the maximum number of bots that will be used in the map. For example, to use no bots specify `Launch.Developer.Bots=""`

A reasonable default is selected for each `Launch.Developer.*` argument. if `Launch.Developer=true` is not present, then OpenRA will start normally.

An example launch is as follows:

```
OpenRA.Game.exe \
  Launch.Developer=true \
  Launch.Developer.Map=texas-sea \
  Launch.Developer.Cheats="DevShroudDisable, DevFastBuild" \
  Launch.Developer.Bots="Rush AI, Turtle AI"
```

This will launch a game directly into the texas-sea map with the shroud disabled and fast build enabled. Further, there will be two AI opponents, one using the Rush AI and the other using the Turtle AI.

data.title: Remove unnecessary conditionals
data.body:
`Game.modData.Manifest.LuaScripts` is never null.
`context.LoadLuaScripts` will work properly even if the file collection is empty.

data.title: Remove an unused setting
data.body: This setting was not used

data.title: Unlimited experience
data.body:
With auto calculated levels and bonuses (faster, more powerful, stronger, regenerates life faster, reloads faster, can transport more, …).
They become as « heroes » like in some other games.
I don’t know if it’s a good idea to see a mammoth tank as fast as a spyplane, destroying a war factory with one shoot, but it will be the main target for the entire enemy team.
Also, it takes a lot of repairs, iron curtains, mechanics, management, etc … to bring it to that level so the most powerful units are inherently the most expensive ones in a game, and they yield the most money when they are destroyed.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4850376-unlimited-experience?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Ore trucks AI
data.body:
Ore trucks should have only one behavior : when they are built (with a refinery or in a war factory) and when they just unloaded their cargo they go to the nearest ore/gems available on the map (obviously not in a straight course but with pathfinding, and friendly mines have to be considered impassable).
If no ore/gems are found they should move away from the refinery (like one cell) and stop (if other trucks have to unload their cargo in the refinery).
Nothing else.

data.title: Auto beacon when teammate is attacked
data.body:
Just an idea, maybe it would be annoying with big fights.

<bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Instant beacon
data.body:
When a beacon is placed on the map, the teammates have to wait 3 s to see which location they have to look at.
The beacon shouldn’t have a « zoom » effect when it’s placed, it should be instantly visible on the minimap (Tanya in front of a building, 3 s and the building is gone), it could have a « zoom out » effect (invert the actual animation) when it disappears or no animation at all.

data.title: Show latency in game
data.body:
Show latency in game and maybe if the host doesn’t receive any action from a player within some seconds (or minutes), mark the player as Gone or Left (like Won or Lost), so the other players can see who is slowing down the game, see if the game crashed and see who crashed ?
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4425158/80fbbf9c-45a6-11e4-967f-3f80ef5c50f4.png)

data.title: Show latencies in ms
data.body:
Green/Orange/Red colors are chosen arbitrary so is it possible to write the latencies in ms in the game lobby ? Something like
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4425146/57ed6114-45a6-11e4-82de-dace4bccc610.png)

data.title: Endgame statistics in .rep files
data.body:
Is it possible to write endgame statistics somewhere in .rep files, so the replays don't need to be « played » by OpenRA to obtain these statistics ?
It's needed to create an automatic ladder system / players ranking / build orders analysis / … without having to play every .rep file.

data.title: Wasted iron curtains
data.body:
I found #5790 because it happens to me almost half the time.
To fix this, is it possible to enlarge the iron curtain effect zone of one cell in all directions and apply the curtain only on the five most centered units inside this zone ?
![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4425083/cd0e5256-45a5-11e4-945d-6fe154c56bd6.png)

data.title: Walls are too strong
data.body:
If a player builds a bunch of walls (with some anti-air or artillery behind), he can block the game forever.
He spends around 1000 $ to build his walls, my 2500 $ nuclear missile (after have waited 9 mins) destroys only five of his walls, and he can rebuild them in 3 s for 100 $.
Even a mammoth tank needs to shoot at it 8 or 9 times during almost 30 seconds to destroy a wall. 3 seconds later, the wall is back.
It's frustrating to see a player hidden and idle behind his walls when you have a very heavy firepower in front of these walls, shooting at them during minutes and minutes (even with nuclear missiles or nuke trucks) and seeing this player always rebuilding them every 3 s, indefinitely.
Some games are stuck because of that.

![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/4425042/7e024938-45a5-11e4-979b-de75bc00e794.png)

Weaken walls or add an option to disable them ?
